column1: hyarmen is a noun meaning "south" in Quenya.
Image:Hyarmen.gifHyarmen is also the name in Quenya of the thirty-third letter of the Tengwar alphabet.  In origin it was a variation on Harma (letter 11) and represented HY
column5: Footnote 1 but by the Third Age its most frequently represents H.
column7: The additional letters  It was one of the most widely known and used of all the Tengwar since it indicated "north" even in languages that used a very different term.  The Westron name for this letter is Há.See Westron Tengwar

column1: In the West-lands of Middle-earth the four cardinal directions were Númen
column5: and they were named in this order
column6: beginning with (and facing) west.  Hyarmen meant a left-hand region and Formen meant a right-hand region.  Thus the word for "south" derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarme KHYAR
